summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from October 2019 regarding logistical updates for a victim briefing related to the Epstein case. It tracks victim and attorney responses, travel arrangements, and interview scheduling between the Miami and New York FBI offices.

persons.name: M, L.
persons.role: FBI Program Manager, Victim Services Division
persons.context: Sends updates on victim briefing logistics, coordinates travel and interviews for victims, and shares a message from a victim.

persons.name: M, N.
persons.context: Requests to make arrangements to speak with specific victims and provides updates on victim availability.

connections.description: Collaborating on victim briefing logistics and interview coordination between FBI offices.

events.title: Epstein Victim Briefing Coordination
events.description: Internal FBI coordination to track victim and attorney responses, schedule interviews, and arrange travel for a victim briefing related to the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively coordinating a victim briefing in October 2019, tracking responses from victims and their attorneys in Miami and New York.
Logistics included scheduling victim interviews, making travel arrangements, and managing RSVPs, indicating an organized post-Epstein death effort to engage victims.
The document shows sensitivity to victim readiness, noting that some may not feel ready to attend despite outreach efforts.
Email headers and signatures are partially redacted, indicating standard internal FBI communication protocols.
